Julissa has her own business, a grocery store.  She started the business six months ago with help from her parents, who provided the capital to be able to do so.  She sells staples like beans, rice, sugar, flour, “maseca” (instant corn dough), soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, cookies, bread, and meat.  There has been demand for her sales because there are not many grocery stores in the area.

This is her first loan with ODEF.  She needs it to stock more products like rice, beans, sugar, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and meat.

Her goal for the future is for her business to grow and to have more customer demand.  She will then get more income, which will help meet the basic needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages, and meat.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Don José Manuel tiene 60 años de edad, es casado hace 39 años, tiene un hijo de de 17 años de edad y vive con su familia en el barrio Suyapa, Tela, Atlantida.

Don José Manuel debido a su situación, por falta de una oportunidad de trabajo, decidió establecer su negocio propio (pulpería), de venta de productos alimenticios de primera necesidad como granos básicos (arroz, sal, azúcar, manteca, carne de pollo refrescos, churros, galletas, gelatinas, pan, cornflakes, salsina y medicamentos. Este negocio tiene 5 años  gracias a su buena administración y la ayuda de su esposa, dedicándole todo el día al negocio.

Con los  financiamientos que a solicitado a ODEF, a logrado incrementar su inventario, en la actualidad solicita otro préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos básicos(arroz,    frijoles,azúcar,harina,maseca,refrescos,lacteos,carne de pollo) para aumentar y mejorar sus ventas de donde está sacando sus ingresos para vivir mejor con su familia

Su meta a seguir es tener un supermercado para poder satisfacer con los productos necesarios la demanda de clientes.
texts.en:
José Manuel, age 60, has been married for 39 years and has a 17 year old child.  He lives with his family in the Suyapapa neighborhood, Tela, Atlantida.

Due to the lack of opportunity for work, José Manuel decided to establish his own business (grocery store).  He sells staple food products like basic grains, rice, salt, sugar, lard, chicken, soft drinks, churros, cookies, gelatin, bread, cornflakes, tomato sauce, and medicines.  He has had this business for five years thanks to his good administration and the help from his wife, devoting all day to the business.

With the loans that he has requested from ODEF he has managed to increase his inventory.  He is currently requesting another loan to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, flour, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, and chicken in order to increase and improve his sales.  He is taking his income in order to live better with his family.

His goal is to have a supermarket in order to have the necessary products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, flour, maseca, soft drinks, dairy products, and chicken.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 52 años es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, esta casado con Luz Marina de 40 años y con quien tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno ya es mayor e independiente, y los menores son Eneida de 13, Meybi de 8 y Eigel de 4. Él vive a lado de su familia en su casa propia, inmueble que pudo comprar gracias a mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Isabel consiste en le venta de comida, tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad en donde va diariamente muy temprano en busca de los mejores ingredientes y las carnes mas fresas para así empezar su día laboral y poder dar lo mejor a sus clientes.  Lleva realizando este trabajo por 1 año y tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa. Hasta hace 2 años se dedicaba a la refacción de zapatos en un pequeño local que tenia pero lamentablemente la vista le empezó a fallar y con eso tuvo que buscar otra manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, ahora decidió empezar con este trabajo que le permite tener algunos ingresos para la tranquilidad de su hogar, tiene muchos planes en mente pero lo que mas desea ahora es poder mantener su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco, es un trabajo muy duro pero esta dispuesto a emprenderlo. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual y responsable todas sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes no perecibles, además de invertir en algunos muebles que le hacen falta para atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 52 years old. He is a good, friendly and very hardworking man. He is married to Luz Marina who is 40 years old. They have four children. One is now older and independent. The younger ones are 13 year old Eneida, eight year old Meybi and four year old Eigel. He lives with his family in their own house that he could buy thanks to lots of effort and sacrifice. 
Isabel sells food. He has a stall in his town’s market. He goes very early every day to find the best ingredients and the freshest meats in order to start his work day and to give his customers the best. He has been doing this work for one year and he wife and children help him. Up until two years ago, he did shoe repairs in a small business that he had. But unfortunately, his sight started to fail and he had to find another way to earn money for his family. 
He decided to start with this work that allows him to have some earnings for his family's tranquility. He has many plans in his mind but what he wants most right now is to be able to maintain his business and make it grow little by little. It is very hard work but he is willing to undertake this job. This will be loan number two with MFP. Therefore, he hopes to continue with this collaboration. On the other hand, he promises once again to pay on time and to be responsible with all of his payments.
With a total loan requested of 1500 soles, he will buy nonperishable ingredients. In addition, he will invest in some needed furniture to serve his customers with more comfort.

loans.use: purchase nonperishable foods to stock his business and furniture to make his stand more welcoming.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Yacine est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants.
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son cycle 2.

Madame fait partie du groupe de solidarité AND JEF, son activité se trouve être le commerce de détails par la vente de de couscous  et de farine de mil et de légumes:

Yacine a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis plusieurs années.

Grace à son nouveau crédit de 350.000 CFA Elle va se procurer de la marchandise (mil) qu'elle va transformer en couscous et revendre au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Madame Yacine nous informe que ses bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa famille toute entière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yacine is a 60-year old woman and the mother of six.

She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” since her second-cycle loan. Mrs. Yacine belongs to the And Jef solidarity group. Her line of business is retailing couscous, millet flour and vegetables.

She has plenty of experience with this work as she has been doing it  for years.
Thanks to her new loan of 350,000 Central African francs, she will  stock up on millet, which she will use to prepare couscous for sale at the small market in her village.
Mrs. Yacine says that her revenues will allow her to provide for her personal needs as well as for the needs of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy millet in order to prepare couscous for sale.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in Central Mongolia. With the help of her husband, she manages a clothes and grocery-product trading business between Ulaanbaatar city and her sum (a subdivision of a province). She sells all kinds of grocery items and a variety of clothes for all ages. Her husband helps with her business and transports the ordered products. Her daughters stay home with her grandmother. 

In 2005, Bayarmaa started her grocery-product trading business. Her business is really going well and she has been increasing her household income significantly. 

Based on her experience, Bayarmaa would like to extend her business by acquiring supplies in a large amount so she can save on transport expenses. She is a hardworking woman who says,"I would like to extend my business so that I can save and spend it to buy supplies next time." The total amount she is requesting is 1,700,000 MNT to buy products to make foods.

loans.use: To purchase products to make foods.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco, ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de utiles y necesita fortalecer el inventario, por eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares, este nuevo préstamo le ayudara para atender la demanda de los estudiantes ya que ha iniciado el ciclo de estudio, su compra será en cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores.
Él considera que este préstamo le ayudara para generar mejores ganancias, ayudando aun más a su familia y poder pagar este préstamo, comenta que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron para cubrir gastos educativos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marco has started up a new office supplies business and needs to strengthen the inventory, so he is seeking a loan for the purchase of school supplies. This new loan will help him meet the demand of the students since the new semester has already started. He will purchase notebooks, pens and markers. 

He believes that this loan will help him generate a better income so he may help his family even more and be able to pay off this loan. He comments that the previous loans helped him cover educational costs for his children.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens and markers.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two children in central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and his son studies at college. 

Ganbat started his business by building a small shop within their fence and in 2005 he extended the business by adding a building. The building consists of two parts -- one half is where he lives and the other half is where he operates his business. 

Ganbat wants to bring supplies in large quantities from the capital city. He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to extend my business by increasing the types of supplies I purchase in large quantities." The total amount he is requesting is 2,400,000 MNT so he can buy supplies for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine would like to borrow a loan of KES 100,000. This will be her third loan. She repaid the previous loans successfully and wishes to use this amount to purchase more beauty products, perfumes and hair conditioners for her cosmetic sales business.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and to invest back into the business. She hopes to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, perfumes and hair conditioners for her cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Lucinda Maribel

texts.es:
Lucinda, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de telas, porque necesita comprarse diversidad de colores para confeccionar ropa, esta nueva inversión le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad de productos.
Ella ha tenido una bonita experiencia trabajando con nuestra institución, dándole una mejor capacidad y calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucinda has decided to request a new loan to buy cloth because she needs to purchase a diversity of colors to make clothing. This new investment will help her improve the availability of products she offers.

Lucinda has had a lovely experience working with our institution, offering her a greater capacity and quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: buy cloth for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Mapendo Plus is a community bank made up of 10 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Sylvie. These members are united by the same goal, which is to grow their businesses through loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Sylvie runs a restaurant in the western suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 35 years old and a mother of five children who are between the ages of 1 and 17. Three of them attend school. 

Sylvie started her food-selling business in 1980. With hard work and good management -- and by providing good customer service -- Sylvie’s business has prospered and she has permanent customers to help maintain the business. 

She has already received and successfully repaid nine loans from MFI HOPE DRC. Her business generates $90 of profit per week. With the new loan, Sylvie is planning to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demands and generate additional profit. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her restaurant to meet customer demands and generate additional profit.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para  la recolección de la cosecha, por lo necesita pagar la mano de obra para realizar la labor, además una parte de este préstamo servirá para apoyar a su esposa en la venta de pupusas, comprando materiales para su venta.
José considera que el préstamo anterior le sirvió porque ha comprado los insumos para la siembra, esto ha sido un progreso para él.
texts.en:
Jose has decided to request a new loan for harvesting his crops. He will need to pay laborers to carry out the work. In addition, a part of the loan will be used to help his wife sell 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran dish) by paying for needed ingredients.

Jose considers his previous loan helpful because he used it to purchase supplies for planting his crop. This  boosted his progress.

loans.use: pay laborers to harvest his crops.

loans.name: Zogbo

texts.en:
Zogbo lives in Airport, Liberia. She is 39 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of 8 and 19 who are in school and live at home. Her husband works at the Robert International Airport. 

For the past 18 years, Zogbo has been selling palm oil in the market. Zogbo says she received a small amount of money from her sister to invest in the business. She enjoys her business because she earns money. 

Zogbo is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her dream is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Damianus

texts.en:
Damianus is a 33-year-old man who is married to Yohana, a 29-year-old lady. They have two children from their marriage: James, a 7-year-old and Akhilas, 6 years old; both are attending elementary school. 

To generate income for his family, Damianus works as a salesman. He initiated the business four years ago by using his own capital. Damianus purchases stock from the supplier such as shampoo, bath soap, medicines, coffee, milk etc to be distributed from one shop to another. He works from 9 am until all his stock is sold out. He rides his motorbike in running the business every day. 

Recently, Damianus expanded his business by selling a kind of cosmetics but he could not provide all the stock demanded by his customers. He cannot afford to buy the products in large quantity as it is more expensive than the other business stock that he sells. 

Damianus heard that TLM usually provides a loan, particularly for small entrepreneurs like him. Damianus then submitted a loan application to TLM. He is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 to purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, face powder, nail polish, etc. Damianus is hoping that he can get the loan shortly.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics such as lipstick, face powder, nail polish, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a fifty-six-year-old farmer from the village of Dzirkoki. He lives with his family: his wife Marine, a thirty-one-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Agriculture is the primary source of the income for the family. They have 0.8 hectares of land with a peach-garden and a vineyard. The family also grows tomato and cucumbers. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris. 

Zaur requested credit to purchase vine saplings to expand the vine-yard. After couple of years the family will harvest and sell more grapes. It will increase their income. Zaur plans to use the increased income to finance the education of his grand-children.

loans.use: to purchase vine saplings.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 34 years old and lives in Air Port Community. She is married with five children, ages 10 to 17 years old, that live at home. For 9 years now, Oretha has been selling dried fish in the market. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business. Oretha wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried cassava fish for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the village Bakurtsikhe, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife – Marine, his parents and grandparents. He married couple of months ago. George works as a taxi driver. He provides a taxi service to the local population. His father works as a baker. His grandparents are retired and get monthly pension. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

George requested credit to purchase a new car to use as a taxi. He will sell his old one and buy a better one. He can provide a higher quality service to his passengers. The number of clients will increase and George will get more income. This will allow the family to spend more on their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car he can use as a taxi.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Air Port Community. She is 37 years old, married, with five children between four and nineteen. They are all in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been involved in a cook shop business (restaurant). She makes good profit and has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es: Lia, de 27 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, por cosas de la vida es madre soltera y tiene que criar a su menor hija Tracy de 6 años ella sola, pero como su carácter es de una mujer pujante y fuerte no se amilana ante nada y esta dispuesta a salir adelante junto a su hija quien significa para ella su motor y motivo de superación. Lia todos los días sale muy temprano de su casa, va en busca de algunos productos a los comerciantes mayoristas de ropa de segunda, de ahí se dirige a su puesto en una céntrica calle rodeada de muchas personas que van a hacer sus compras, ahí aprovecha en ofrecer sus productos que vende, además cuando no tiene muchas ventas en su puesto se dirige a los caseríos o pueblos cercanos para poderlos vender o cambiarlos por aves de corral. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 4 años y le gusta mucho ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y en algunas ocasiones viajar. Le va muy bien ya que vende mucho, y más cuando vende en otros lugares. Espera seguir trabajando y progresar poco a poco y así mas adelante montar un local de venta de ropa. Este será el tercer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta por que le brindaran un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Esta contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que ve que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas prendas de vestir ya que desea ir por los caseríos y pueblos que es en donde vende más y así obtiene más ganancias.
texts.en:
Lia, 27, is a good, friendly and enterprising woman. Regarding her life circumstances she is a single mother and has to raise her youngest daughter Tracy who is six all by her herself. Nevertheless, as her character is that of an exuberant and strong woman, she is not daunted by anything and is willing to move forward along with her daughter, who is her driving force and reason for overcoming. Every day Lia goes out very early in search of products from the wholesale merchants of secondhand clothing. From there she heads to her post on a downtown street surrounded by many people who are doing their shopping. There she takes the opportunity to display her products for sale. Additionally, when she isn't making many sales at her stand she heads for the nearby hamlets or pueblos in order to sell her products or exchange them for poultry. She has been doing this work for four years and enjoys it a lot since she is in charge of her own schedule and occasionally may travel. It's going very well for her since she sells a lot, and more when she sells in other places. She hopes to keep working and making progress little by little, and thus in the future to set up a clothing shop. 

This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy that they would offer her financial support so she can increase her working capital. She knows she will have to be very responsible and above all highly punctual. With the requested amount of 2,000 Peruvian soles she will purchase more items of apparel since she wishes to pass through the hamlets and pueblos which is where she sells more, and so makes better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Rita Enrique

texts.es:
Rita, se ha decido a seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de cerdos, por eso solicita este nuevo préstamo para comprarse cerdos para el engorde, esperando que esta nueva inversión sea favorable y pueda generar buenas ventas a futuro.
Ella ha tenido una mejor capacidad en su granja, además a apoyado a su familia, con el manejo del negocio.
texts.en: Rita has decided to continue investing in the pork industry, so she is asking for this new loan in order to buy pigs to fatten up. She hopes that this investment with allow her to generate good sales in the future. Through managing her business she has had improved success with her farm, and she has also been able to support her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 52 years old, married to Jemima, and they come from Kisumu city, in the western part of Kenya. They have five children aged from nine to 20 years of age.

Nicholas operates a tailoring and dressmaking business and has been doing this business for the last 25 years. He makes a monthly income of KES.18,000. He is taking his first loan with KADET LTD which he will use to buy textile materials for dressmaking. He will channel anticipated profit into purchasing two other sewing machines.

His desire is to venture into a tailoring school and provide for his family fully.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Hengky

texts.en:
Hengky is a 36-year-old man; he is married to Yohana, a 34-year-old lady. They have two children: Geraldine, 9, studying at the 4th grade of Elementary School; and Marven, 2.

Hengky owns a kiosk business selling household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks and soft drinks. He initiated the business one and a half years ago using his own capital. This business is really vital to Hengky as it enables him to cover his family's living expenses.

The increase in market price and demand for more stock from the customers led Hengky to seek more money to buy various items. Unfortunately he does not have enough capital for business improvement. One day, he got information from his neighbor about TLM. He then submitted a loan application and requested a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000. Hengky plans to spend the loan on petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks. Hengky hopes that his loan application will be approved soon.

loans.use: to purchase petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr:
Thioro est une femme mariée âgée de 35 Ans et mère de 6 enfants et une nièce à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois de Kiwi depuis son cycle 2.
Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Bokk liguéy.
Thioro fait de l'embauche bovine depuis longtemps.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300000 elle va acheter 4 moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre au niveau de son village et ville environnantes.
Madame Thioro nous dit que les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thioro is a married woman who is 35 years old and mother to six children; she also has a niece in her care.

She has been a member of the Kiwi Banc Villageois since her second loan cycle. She belongs to the Bokk Liguéy solidarity group.

Thioro has been fattening beef for a long time and has good experience in her field as she has been doing it for such a long time. With her new loan of 300,000 francs she is going to buy four sheep to raise and resell in her village and surrounding towns.

Thioro tells us that the profits she makes from her business allow her to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy sheep that she will raise and sell later

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Air Port Community. She is 45 years old and married with a child, age 20 years old. Her husband is a driver. They live together and their child attends school.

Esther has been selling fish for the past 8 years. Esther says she has lots of expenses at home. Sometimes she has to use her business money for other expenses and this leads to some breakdown of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava fish and Bonnie fish to enlarge her business. Her plan is to save more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava fish and Bonnie fish to enlarge her business

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tawopaneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 SLL for each to enable them further improvement on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the right is Kadiatu, who is the leader of this group. The 58-year-old Kadiatu was born in Lunsar town. She is married to a paramount chief and the couple has three children.

Kadiatu sells rice, beans, millet, bulgur wheat, corn, etc.. She has been doing this business for more than 30 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, millet, bulgur wheat, corn, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is from the village Vartsikhe, West Georgia. He is 39 years old, unmarried and lives with his mother (retired). The family owns a milk cow. They sell milk to local dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy, Abel has a 1.75 hectare vineyard. He sells grapes, as well as homemade wine. Abel also owns a small grocery store in the village.  He purchases grocery products in nearby towns’ wholesale markets and sells them in his store. Total average monthly income of the family, including Abel’s mother monthly pension, is 230 GEL.

Abel requested credit to increase stock in the store. Once he offers a wide assortment of products, the amount of the clients will increase, followed by increase in sales and income. Abel and his mother will be able to spend more on satisfying their daily needs. It will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to increase stock in the store

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr:
Koami est un homme âgé  de 55 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a  03 enfants. Le premier a 30 ans et le dernier a 24 ans.  
Koami travaille comme menuisier  depuis 1990. Il travaille seul et sollicite ce troisième crédit pour acheter des bois pour la fabrication de meubles.
Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité les profits supplémentaires.
Dans les prochaines années, Koami voudrait agrandir son activité afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille .
texts.en:
Koami is a 55-year old man who is married to a retailer. He has three children, the eldest being 30 and the youngest 24 years old.

Koami has been working as a carpenter since 1990. He works alone and is requesting this third loan to buy wood for making furniture. He wants to invest further profits in his business. 

In the coming years, Koami would like to expand his business so that he can take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old. She is married to James and they have four children aged between two and 21 years.

She operates a retail shop selling household necessities and has operated this business for the last 19 years, making a monthly income of KES. 19,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD and she will use her profits to buy more stock of retail goods for sale in her shop, e.g., sugar and milk, bread and tea leaves for sale.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop one day where she will be able to sell goods to other small-scale traders.

loans.use: To buy more retail stock like sugar and milk.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 38 years of age. She is married to David and supports a family of 6 people. She has been in business for 2 years and generates a monthly income of 5,000 KES.The loan will be used to purchase more stock; to buy food commodities like sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour for sale.

The anticipated profits will be used to expand the business and also educate the children. This is her third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. Stella's dream is to see her business grow and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 38-year-old lady from Bungoma town and is married to Kenneth. They have two children aged four and 10 years.

Virginia operates a second-hand clothing business, a business she has been doing for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES. 11,800. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more bales of used clothing for sale.


 
She will plow her profits back into her business. Her dream is to run a successful business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr:
Yao est un homme âgé de 27ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse et n’a pas d’enfants.
Yao travaille comme soudeur ferrailleur  depuis 2007. Il exerce son activité dans un atelier. Sa difficulté est la concurrence.
Yao a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une perceuse pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut développer son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yao voudrait installer d’autres ateliers pour mieux servir sa clientéle. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’avoir une famille bien heureuse.
texts.en:
Yao is a 27-year old man who is married to a retailer; he has no children.

He has been working as a welder and scrap metal merchant since 2007 and carries out his activity in a workshop. His problem is competition. 

Yao has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a drill so that he can satisfy customer demand more easily. He wants to develop his business and in the coming years he would like to set up other workshops to provide a better service for his customers. He says that he is planning to have a happier family thanks to the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy a drill

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, continua con su venta de comida, el cual hace ambulante con su medio transporte una minicaponera, en donde lleva sus panas, y valdes de frescos, recorriendo varios kilometros, siendo madre soltera hoy en dia de tres hijos estudiantes.
Tambien vende comida en su casa, pero vende mas ambulante, es por tal razon se esfuerza cada dia. Como meta es ir mejorando su casa, es por tal razon desea tener un kiosko fijo en donde pueda, obtener mejores resultado de venta, y ingresos.
Con este nuevo prestamo invertira en compra de granos basicos,  carne, pollo, frutas y verduras para tener variedad en los platillos.
texts.en:
Rosa continues to sell meals in the streets from her cart, courageously pushing her supplies various kilometers. She is a single mother with 3 children in school. Rosa also sells meals in her house, but she sells more in the streets. That is why she works so hard every day.

Rosa's goal is to continue improving her house, and for that reason, she would like to have a fixed kiosk where she could obtain better results in sales and income.

This new loan will be used to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, fruit, and vegetables to introduce variety into her plates.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruit, and vegetables to augment her sales of meals.

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es:
Juana Pabla es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes, sabanas y servilleta típicas, tiene 10 años de experiencia, inició este trabajo siendo trabajadora para otro negocio. 

Decide solicitar otro préstamo para invertirlo como capital de trabajo para su propio negocio, para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, y seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ganancias, ya que su objetivo es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Juana Pabla is married, 28 years of age, and has two children, one of whom is going to school. She earns a living weaving traditional skirts, ponchos and napkins. She has ten years of experience and began this business as a worker for another business. 

She decided to seek another loan to invest as working capital in her own business, for the purchase of various types and colors of yarn, and to keep working and improving her earnings, since her goal is that her business would grow.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastasia, necesita un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, ella comprara tomates, chiles, cebolla, quesillo, repollo, que son productos que necesita para el negocio.
Ella considera que el trabajo con préstamos le ha ayudado para mantenerse con el negocio y poder también cambiar las circunstancias de la familia.
texts.en:
Anastasia needs a new loan to strengthen her business.  She will buy tomatoes, chilies, onions, cheese, and cabbage, which are products she needs for her business.

Anastasia thinks that working with these loans has helped her to stay in business and has enabled her to change her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chiles, onions, cheese, and cabbage

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She does poultry farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es: Marjorie, de 20 años es una joven amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Es soltera y no tiene hijos, solo tiene la responsabilidad de brindar apoyo a su familia y es por quienes a diario trabaja mucho para así mejorar su condición de vida. Vive en casa de su tía a quien colabora en algunas cosas del hogar. El trabajo de Marjorie consiste en la pastelería, se encarga de realizar tortas, pasteles, kekes, y algunos bocaditos que le encargan sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo por un año y lo hace en su pequeño taller implementado en la casa en donde vive. Trabaja sola ya que por el momento sus pedidos son pocos pero más adelante lo va a necesitar. Le gusta mucho la pastelería ya que desde muy joven aprendió a hacer este trabajo que aprendio de su tía y de algunas otras personas. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendra un apoyo financiero ya que así se sentirá más tranquila al momento de realizar su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a seguir siendo un cliente puntual como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo y poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene en espera.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 20, is a good, friendly and very hardworking woman. She is single and has no children, only the responsibility of providing support to her family for whom she works hard every day in order to improve their living conditions. She lives in her aunt's home where she helps maintain the household. Marjorie's work consists of making pastries. She has the task of making flan, cakes, and other snacks her customers order from her. She has been doing this work for one year and works out of a small workshop set up in the house where she lives. She works alone since for the time being she has only a few orders but down the road she will need assistance. She enjoys making pastries very much since she learned to do this work at an early age from her aunt and some other people. 

This will be her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know she will have financial support so she will experience a greater sense of calm while working. She promises to continue being a punctual client as she was with her previous loan. With the requested amount of 600 Peruvian soles she will purchase ingredients and supplies to keep on doing her work and fulfill the orders she has pending.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for making more cakes.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
La señora Dorotea es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos de los  cuales ninguno estudia,se dedica al tejido de corte típicos, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta don el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varios colores, espera ver el el futuro un negocio grande, y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dorotea is 48 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has four children, and none of them go to school.

She devotes herself to weaving traditional clothes.  She started this business as a machine operator, and she now has ten years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who does the same work.

She is requesting a loan to buy various colors of yarn.  In the future she hopes to see a big business with improved income.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.es:
Meliza, de 25 años es una mujer joven, amable y emprendedora, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y hermanos con quienes comparte la casa en donde le enseñaron los buenos modales y a trabajar. Ahora se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un puesto en un mercado que es muy céntrico, ahi concurre mucha gernte por eso es que el negocio le es rentable. Ella diariamene tiene que madrugar para ir al puerto de la ciudad y comprar la variedad de productos marinos. Le gusta la libertad que le da este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y haciendo deporte además de estar a lado de su familia, lleva más de 1 año realizando este trabajo, y aunque no tiene mucha experiencia aprendiño mucho a diario con las cosas que le suceden. Espera seguir trabajando y progresar. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, compará más productos para vender y así ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad de pescados a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Meliza, 25, is a friendly and enterprising young woman.  She is single and has no children.  She works hard so that she can provide a better quality of life to her parents and siblings, with whom she shares the house where she was taught good manners and hard work. Now she has a business selling fish.  She has a stall in a market that is centrally located and very busy, and for this reason her business is profitable.  Every day she gets up at dawn to go to the port in the city and buy a variety of seafood.  She likes the freedom this job provides her, because she can have some fun in the afternoons playing sports, and she also has time to be with her family.  She has been doing this work for more than a year, and although she doesn't have a lot of experience she is learning a lot every day with the things that happen in the business.  She hopes to continue to work and make progress.  This will be her 4th loan with MFP, and she is very pleased to know that she will have financial support, because this way she feels more sure that she will be able to get ahead with her business.  Furthermore, she is committed once again to making all of her loan payments, as she did in the previous loans that she took.  Also, she appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of the members are very supportive and responsible.  

With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles she requests, she will buy more products to sell so that in this way she can offer a greater variety of high quality fish to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es: José, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, él quiere comprar materiales para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, con esto está dando un paso más para el progreso y desarrollo junto a su familia, José por medio de esta ayuda estará mejorando continuamente las instalaciones de la vivienda, para ofrecer a sus seres queridos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: José has decided to seek a new loan. He wants to purchase materials for installing an electrical system in his home. With this he is taking one more step towards progress and development along with his family. José, by means of this support, will be constantly improving his living quarters, in order to offer his loved ones a better kind of life.

loans.use: to pay for installing an electrical system in his home.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 28 years old, single, and blessed with one child. Bella sells wedding flowers and clothes. She has been in this business for the last one and one-half years and earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

She is applying for her first KADET LTD loan of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy stock for her business like dresses and wedding flowers for decoration. She will use the anticipated profit to save for the future of her son.

Bella hopes to have a firm with decorations for all weddings or functions, and to meet her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy wedding flowers and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a modest 43-year-old business lady from Vihiga town. She is married to Henry and they have four children.

Gladys sells cereals, mainly maize, and has been running this business for the last nine years. She sells mainly maize cereals due to big demand and ready markets. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more maize cereals to boost her current stock. She hopes to make enough profits, which she will use to pay back the loan. Her dream is to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize cereals.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old, married, and has six children. To earn a living, she farms, which she has been doing for 25 years. Esther employs one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Esther is requesting a loan for 10,900 KES, which she will use to buy fertilizer and a solar lamp. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and a solar lamp.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 49-year-old businessman. He is married to Kalilwa. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Daniel will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal for his business.

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.es: Fredisminda, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprarse una refrigeradora, ya que es de mucha necesidad, tambien comprara materia prima para hacer los panes con pollo, condimentos, verduras, plásticos para empacarlos, bebidas, todo esto será para mejorar el negocio y sobre todo el servicio a los clientes. Ella considera que ha evolucionado desde su primer préstamo, ya que es un apoyo para el negocio del cual se benefician todos en la familia.
texts.en: Fredisminda has decided to apply for a new loan to buy herself a refrigerator, since it is a great need. She will also buy basic ingredients to make her chicken sandwiches with vegetables: seasonings, vegetables, plastic for wrapping, and beverages. All this will be to improve her business and above all to serve her customers. She feels that she has made progress since her first loan, since it (the loan) is a support for her business which benefits everyone in the family.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, vegetables, plastic for wrapping, beverages, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Freddy Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Freddy es un hombre al que le gusta mucho trabajar, disfruta de su labor diario, actualmente el vive en la ciudad de Ica, lugar caracterizado por el intenso sol durante todo el año, la misma que es aclamada como la “Tierra del Sol” por todos los iqueños, esta ciudad también se caracteriza por las exportaciones que se realizan al mundo, entre los productos más conocidos se tienen a las alcachofas y espárragos. En el transcurso de estos últimos 5 años, Ica se ha desarrollado enormemente con la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales, los mismos que han permitido generar nuevos y mejores puestos de trabajo.

Para poder salir adelante y generar los ingresos que Freddy necesita, se dedica a brindar el servicio de carpintería, elaborando y brindándole mantenimiento a puertas, sillas, mesas, entre otros muebles. Él se dedica a este negocio aproximadamente 10 horas al día, tiempo en el que atiende a solo 1 cliente, debido a que es muy meticuloso en su trabajo y siempre está en el afán de brindarle los mejores productos a sus clientes, también trabaja como gasfitero, servicio que le permite tener algunos ingresos extras. Freddy tiene éxito en su empresa debido a que se ha hecho conocido en la zona en donde vive, aprendió de su maestro maderero, lamentablemente el falleció hace un año y Freddy aún se siente muy apenado por su pérdida.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Freddy podrá realizar la compra de una máquina especial para su carpintería y con esta podrá atender mucho más rápido a sus clientes, así con mucho esfuerzo podrá ser conocido no solo en su zona si no también otros lugares. El confía en que su esfuerzo y dedicación lo llevaran a tener una carpintería bien equipada y a su vez una casa propia.
texts.en:
Señor Freddy is a man who very much likes to work. He enjoys his daily labor. Now he lives in the city of Ica, a place characterized by its intense sun throughout the entire year, and so it is acclaimed as the "Tierra del Sol" (land of the sun) by all the Iqueños (citizens of Ica). This city is also known for the exports that it sends to the world; among its most well-known products are artichokes and asparagus. In the course of the last five years, Ica has developed enormously with the opening of new commercial centers that have allowed the generation of new and better jobs.

To be able to advance and generate the income that he needs, Freddy offers carpentry services, making and offering maintenance for doors, chairs, and tables, among other furniture. He works at this business approximately 10 hours a day, time in which he usually serves one customer, since he is very meticulous in his work and is always eager to offer better products to his customers. He also works as a plumber, which allows him to have some extra income. Freddy has success in his business because he has become known in the zone where he lives. He learned from a master carpenter; unfortunately he died a year ago and Freddy still feels very grieved by his loss.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, Freddy will be able to purchase a special machine for his carpentry work, and with it he will be able to serve his customers more rapidly. Thus with much effort he will be known not only in his zone but also in other areas. He is confident that his effort and dedication will lead him to have a well-equipped carpentry shop and, in its turn, his own house.

loans.use: to buy a special machine for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 48 years old, married, and has two children.  She is married to a businessman.  Jacinta is a mixed crop farmer, which she has been doing for 10 years.  Her monthly income is 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Jacinta is requesting her first loan from  KADET LTD, which she will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  She was introduced to KADET by an existing customer. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. She hopes to venture into pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Nemesio De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Nemesio continua laborando como chofer, con varios años fijo en su labor, siendo de prioridad, las mejoras  a su casa de habitacion, en donde ha logrado avanzar, hoy en dia, su casa es de concreto, embaldozo y termino de cerrar viga, lo que ahora con este nuevo financiamiento, podra terminar de cerrar el techo, y puertas comprando laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, esperando terminar y ajustar con el capital.
Lo que para el es de gran sastifacion este proyecto, que vendra  adar mejor seguridad y comodidad  a su familia.
texts.en:
Nemesio continues working as a driver.  He has been in this job for years.  His priority is making improvements to his home and he has managed to make progress in this.  Now his house is built from concrete and tiles, and he has finished putting up joists.  He will use this new loan to finish building his roof and install doors.  He will buy sheets of metal, beams and bolts.  He hopes to finish the job with this capital.

This project is of great satisfaction to Nemesio as it will provide his family with greater security and comfort.

loans.use: to install a roof and gates/grilles, thereby providing his family with greater security and comfort

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Baqa’a, Amman, Jordan.

Khawlah is planting mushrooms and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase mushrooms seeds.

Khawlah is looking to increase her production and educate her children on how to plant the mushrooms so that they can help her grow her business and give them an additional income source.

loans.use: to purchase mushrooms seeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana, de 39 años, es una amable mujer, emprendedora y muy sociable, lamentablemente por cosas de la vida quedo viuda hace algún tiempo pero eso no le impidió poder dar educación y buenos hábitos a su hija Sindy de 21 años a quien cría como una madre sola que es. Juntas viven en su casa propia en donde a parte de tener a su lado a su hija también tiene ahí a su madre a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su vejez. Durante mucho tiempo Juliana vio la manera de sobre salir en este mundo competitivo en lo laboral, realizo todo tipo de trabajo, hasta que un día gracias a una amiga la invito a ir a una venta de pescados en un mercado de la ciudad, fue ahí donde descubrió que podría hacer éste trabajo y que le gustaba como se desarrollaba, además le permitiría tener tiempo para estar a lado de su hija y mejor aun brindar un ingreso a su economía. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 10 años y aprendió mucho de todas las experiencias que le pasaron, en su trabajo es muy querida por sus compañeros de local ya que siempre esta con una sonrrisa y una palabra de aliento para sus amigas. Tiene muchos planes en mente pero por el momento lo que mas desea es poder seguir trabajando y mas adelante poder poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará mas variedad de pescado, por que tiene como finalidad empezar a vender en mayor cantidad y variedad.
texts.en:
Juliana, 39, is a pleasant, enterprising, and very sociable woman.  Unfortunately, due to unforeseen circumstances, she was widowed some time ago, but this did not prevent her from giving an education and good habits to her daughter Sindy, 21, whom she is raising as a single mother.  Together they live in her own home where, in addition to her daughter at her side, she also has her mother, whom she wants to give a better quality of life for her old age.

For a long time Juliana saw that work was the way to stand out in this competitive world.  She did all types of jobs until one day, thanks to a friend who invited her to a fish sale in a market in the city, she discovered that she could do this job and that she liked how it worked.  Also, it would allow her to have time to be with her daughter and, even better, have an income for her finances.

She has been doing her job for ten years, and she learned a lot from all the experiences she had.  In her job she is very well loved by her fellow workers because she always has a smile and an encouraging word for her friends.  She has lots of plans in mind but for the moment what she most wants is to be able to continue working, and later be able to set up a grocery store in her house.

This will be her eighteenth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have some financial help because this way she will feel more sure of making progress with her work.  She also promises once more to make the payments on time, as with the previous loans she had.

With the requested loan of 1000 PEN she will buy more variety of fish, with the goal of beginning to sell in greater quantity and variety.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish.

loans.name: Nadiah

texts.en:
Nadiah is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Nadiah has a home-based project in which she sells cleaning products and baby's diapers, and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase cleaning products  with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed aged 30 years is a married man with one child living in Kyenjojo Uganda.  He deals in produce a and has been in business for the last three years. 

He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start his current business.  He intends to build a permanent house and to diversify his businesses to include cattle trade.  Obed needs the loan facility to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old and married to Wanza and they are blessed with four children.  Peter owns a quarry in Lukenya where most of his clients are Mombasa road contractors.  He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Peter has got a good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD., which he plans to use to expand the quarry business by buying another plot.  He will use the anticipated profit to acquire additional assets.

He hopes to own a carter to help transport cut stones to all of Ukambani.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy another quarry site.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison aged 45 years is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He is a farmer in the same town.

He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start commercial farming.  His family goal is to educate his children and his business dream is to venture into mechanized farming.  Edison wants a loan to pay workers who are clearing land for crop growing.

loans.use: To pay workers who are clearing land for crop growing.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 43 years old.  He lives in the village Amaghleba, West Georgia with his family, his wife Shorena and three children (ages 18, 16 and 11 years old).  All of the children go to school. 

Emzar works as a shepherd in the village.  At the same time he is actively involved in family agricultural activities, which are the main source of the income for the family.  They own a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows.  Shorena produces cheese and sells it at local market.  Also the family owns a vineyard with 400 vine-trees.  Emzar makes wine and sells it locally.  Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris.

Emzar requested credit for purchasing materials for the house renovation.  Their house is not renovated and it is old.  After the renovation the family will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a better environment.

loans.use: To purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes (Bamako clothes, etc.), men/women’s jeans, sandals, etc.in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 39-year-old married woman from  Baqa’a, Jordan and she is a mother of six children.

Najah is selling blankets, clothes and accessories, through her home-based project. Najah was able to purchase a bus to distribute her products with. She paid some of the principle in cash and the remainder through a previous loan. 

Now Najah is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase clothes and blankets. She is looking to purchase a home and provide financing for her son's higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and blankets for business purposes.

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en:
Rahmeh is a 40-year-old married woman from Baqa’a, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Rahmeh is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance for her home with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her home.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, quiere continuar en el negocio, por eso está motivada a seguir invirtiendo con un nuevo préstamo en la compra de cerdos para la granja, manteniendo el oficio, con los cuidados necesarios y velar para que la alimentación de los cerdos sea adecuada, ya que los clientes pagan por el peso de ellos.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo, manteniendo a su familia en condiciones más favorables.
texts.en:
Dinora wants to continue with her business. That's why she is motivated to continue investing through a new loan. 

She will buy pigs for her small farm, maintaining her livelihood by providing the care they need, and ensuring that the pigs receive adequate feed. This is because her customers pay by weight. She has had a good experience with loan, supporting her family under more favorable conditions.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her small farm.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, se ha decidido por un préstamo nuevo, porque considera que con estos financiamientos su negocio irá creciendo, en esta vez comprara hilo, pega, suelas y chinchas (clavos para zapatos), él considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo con la compra que realizo anteriormente, además que pudo salir con el pago del crédito.
Sus condiciones y las de su familia son mejores que antes, todo al buen manejo del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ricardo has decided to request a new loan because he believes that this financing will help his business to grow.  This time he will buy thread, glue, soles, and tacks (for shoes).  He feels that the previous purchases he made had a positive impact.  He was also able to repay the loan.

His and his family’s living conditions have improved, due to his good management of the loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Zulma Arely

texts.es:
Zulma, quiere trabajar con un nuevo préstamo, para comprar nuevos elementos para la granja, comprara cerdos, así podrá aumentar el número en el corral y poder tener más oportunidad de ventas.
Ella considera que su experiencia con el préstamo fue positiva, dándole lugar a manejar mejor el negocio, cambiando en algunas cosas, su forma de vida, con las ventas tambien logro invertir en su familia, ella está motivada para continuar trabajando de la mejor manera.
texts.en: Zulma wants to work with a new loan to buy new items for her farm.  She will buy pigs to increase the number in her corral and have more sales opportunities.  She believes that her experience with the loan was positive allowing her to better manage her business, changing a few things and her way of life.  With the sales she was also able to invest in her family.  She’s motivated to continue working in the best possible way.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, continua en su labor confeccionando prendas de vestir, esta nueva solicitud es para la compra de telas de diferentes colores, hilo, broches, botones, para darle seguimiento a la sastrería y lograr salir con el pedido de uniformes escolares que se le ha realizado, ya que don José quiere realizar un buen trabajo para atraer a más clientes.
Él ha cambiado con su taller, ya que tiene más demanda, porque ha contraído contrato con dos escuelas más para confeccionar los uniformes escolares, este es un avance para José.
texts.en: José continues making clothes.  This new request is to buy fabric in various colors, thread, clasps and buttons to continue tailoring and manage to finish an order for school uniforms he has since José wants to do a good job so that he can attract more customers.  He has changed his workshop since he has more demand because he’s landed two contracts with schools to make their school uniforms which is a step forward for José.

loans.use: to buy fabric in various colors, thread, clasps and buttons.

loans.name: Refqa

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Refqa was not willing to upload her picture on the internet, so the woman in the photo is her daughter.

Refqa is a 56-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Refqa is trading in scrap metal like iron and copper and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase scrap metal with an aspiration of purchasing a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal like iron and copper for business purposes.

loans.name: Mario Nicolas

texts.es:
El joven Mario Nicolas es soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, esta graduado de la carrera de computación, se dedica a la tejeduría, lleva 3 años de experiencia, inicio este negocio siendo operario.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para utilizarlo en la compra de una computadora para uso personal y la compra de hilos para producción mas tejidos, espera tener un negocio de tejido capitalizado y grande.
texts.en:
Young Mario Nicolas is 21 years old and single.  He has completed his studies in information services and is a weaver.  He’s been doing this for three years and started out as a worker.

He will use the money from the loan he’s requesting to buy a computer for personal use and also to buy more thread.  He hopes to develop a large funded weaving business.

loans.use: to buy a computer and thread.

loans.name: Lamya

texts.en:
Lamya is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Lamya sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase more quantities of clothes for her business.

Lamya is looking to open a shop for her business so that she can increase her customer base as well as her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for business purposes.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Myasar is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Myasar is requesting a loan of 400 JD do maintenance on her home with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Jose Arquimides

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la agricultura, ya que comprara los materiales que son necesarios para la siembra como el abono, herbicidas, para iniciar el cultivo de chile y maíz.
Él manifiesta que su trabajo agrícola ha sido más provechoso, que ha obtenido buena producción de chile y maíz, espera que esta nueva inversión sea igual de provechosa.
texts.en:
José has decided to apply for a new loan to invest in farming. He will buy the necessary materials for planting, such as fertilizer and herbicides for starting off his chili and corn crop. 

He states that his farming has been more profitable, and that he has obtained good chili and corn production. He hopes that this new investment will be equally profitable.

loans.use: To by fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Carmen tiene muchos años de ser una pequeña comerciante del municipio de El Sauce donde ofrece a sus clientes variedad de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos.

Gracias a esta actividad ha mejorado su calidad de vida ya que ha preparado a sus hijos profesionalmente, al igual que su vivienda con todas sus condiciones lo que le da gran satisfacción porque en gran parte Ceprodel le ha contribuido a este desarrollo con sus créditos que le ha otorgado para adquirir mercadería y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes lo que le genera mayores ganancias.

En estos momentos doña Juana tiene necesidad de capital para invertir en su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada de inicio de clases en nuestro país por lo que sus clientes le realizan pedidos de zapatos, uniformes colegiales y útiles escolares, por tal razón está solicitando su séptimo crédito para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y de esta forma continuar en sus esfuerzos de superación ya que ella es una mujer de mucho coraje y entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana del Carmen has been a small businesswoman in the town of El Sauce for many years, where she sells a variety of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

Her quality of life has improved, thanks to this business, and she has prepared her children for professional careers, as well as having her home in s state that provides her with great satisfaction.  Ceprodel has contributed to this development in large part, though the loans they have granted, allowing her to acquire merchandise to meet her customer demand.  This provides her with great earnings.

At the moment Ms. Juana is in need of working capital to invest into her business.  Now that the school season in our country is approaching, her customers have requested shoes, school uniforms, and school supplies.  She is asking for her seventh loan so that she can meet her customer demand and continue her efforts to succeed.  She is a woman of great courage and enthusiasm.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 37-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Ghada has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD purchase goods for her grocery store.

Ghada is looking to open a supermarket and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Las Manitos De Jesús Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irma de 31 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son aún son dependientes. Tiene 4 meses con Edaprospo y se dedica a la artesanía de pulseras con el cual lleva 2 años en este negocio. Comenzó cuando tejía para otra persona que se dedicaba a la venta de esta, luego decidió poner su propio negocio. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado comprarse algunos electrodomésticos y artefactos para el uso en su casa. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono; mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de sus cuotas. Su plan para el futuro es construir su casa y aperturar un local comercial. Usará el reciente préstamo en la compra de materiales como hilos y macramé. Ella pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Manitos de Jesús”, nombre que le pusieron por acuerdo entre todas las socias y que esta conformado por 6 personas. Irma tiene 4 meses como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Irma, 31, has a spouse and three children who are still dependent.  She’s been in Edaprospo for four months.  She makes bracelets, a craft she’s been in for two years.  She started out working weaving for another person who sold these items but then decided to open her own business.  With effort and work she managed to buy some home appliances and artifacts for home use.  She currently uses her income to pay water, light and telephone costs while her husband covers food and loan payments.  Her plan for the future is to build her house and open a store.  She will use the current loan to buy materials like thread and macramé.

She belongs to the “Las Manitos de Jesús” communal bank, a name all the members agreed upon since there are six members.  Irma has been serving as group President for four months.

loans.use: to buy thread and macramé.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo, es casado tienen  59 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de tomate en los días de plaza de la ciudad, inició este negocio con al apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la atención del hogar con los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de tomate, ya que El hace reventa del mismo producto los días de plaza y para mejorar  ganancia quiere amplia su venta, espera en el futuro, tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 59, married, and has one child. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He has one child.  

During the day, he sells tomatoes in the city plaza. He started this business with his parents' support, and so far has 10 years experience. He has his wife's support, as she looks after the home and does the household chores. 

He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy tomatoes, as he resells the same product during the days in the plaza, and he wants to expand his sales in order to earn more. He hopes to have a large business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old, married and lives in Airport community with her husband along with their three children aged 6 to 9 that are in school. 

She has been selling dried fish for 15 years now and learnt this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business. She enjoys her business because it makes her independent, in future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar Antonio de 34 años de edad, se casó hace 2 años, tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, vive en la aldea Lempira, Morazán, Yoro.

Hace dos años que Cesar tiene su propio negocio de talabartería, donde elabora monturas para caballos, y fajas de cuero. Al inicio le ayudo su madre luego reinvirtió las ganancias para ir creciendo poco a poco.
Esta actividad siempre le ha gustado, además deja buenas ganancias.  El trabaja 10 horas diarias todos los días.
Muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada de poder trabajar con préstamos para mantener materia prima disponible. Con este préstamo solicitado comprara, hilos, cuero, cuerina y suela.
Tiene como meta llegar a tener su propia casa o ampliar más el negocio para satisfacer a los clientes y a darle un mejor nivel a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Antonio, 34, married two years ago; he has a nine-year-old son and lives in the village of Lempira in Morazán, Yoro.

Cesar has had his own saddle and harness making business for two years where he manufactures saddles for horses and leather harnesses.  At the beginning his mother helped him and later he reinvested his profits in order to grow little by little.

He’s always liked this activity and besides it produces good profits.  He works ten hours a day every day.  He is very grateful with the opportunity provided to be able to work with loans in order to have raw materials on hand.  He will use this loan to buy thread, leather, faux leather and sole-leather.  His goal is to have a house of his own and to expand the business so that he can meet customer demand and give his family a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy saddle making supplies.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, quien solía ser una ama de casa pero que un día con apoyo de su esposo decidió iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos, joyas . Ya tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ella vende de manera ambulante sus clientes son personas que trabajan en oficinas, estudiantes universitarios amas de casa las cuales ella visita a de domicilio así se  gana la vida de manera honrada y en seña a sus hijos a ser personas de bien trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para compra de útiles escolares, cuadernos, uniformes, mochilas, zapatos, faldas , camisetas. Pues son artículos que le están solicitando sus clientes y se vende como ´´´Pan Caliente´´. 
Una de sus meyas es poner una tienda de mercadería en general y hacer reparaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
María, 50, used to be a housewife but one day with help from her husband she decided to start a business selling clothes, shoes, perfume, cosmetics and jewelry.  She’s now been in business seven years.  She sells in an ambulatory fashion; her customers tend to be office employees, university students and housewives that she visits in their homes.  In this way she earns her livelihood honestly and teaches her children to be hardworking people.

She’s asking for a loan to buy school supplies, notebooks, uniforms, backpacks, shoes, skirts and t-shirts because these are the items her customers are asking for and they sell like “hot bread.”   One of her goals is to open a general store and to do some home repairs.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, notebooks, uniforms, backpacks, shoes, skirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Blanca Beatriz

texts.es:
Blanca, quiere iniciar con otro préstamo, en esta ocasión lo utilizara para la reparación de una plancha donde elabora las tortillas y compra de repuestos, ya que en ella es donde cocina sus tortillas para venderla, por lo que es preciso que esté en buenas condiciones.
Ella considera que ha tenido un buen trabajo con el préstamo anterior, ha mantenido a su familia en buenas condiciones y no han pasado dificultades.
texts.en:
Blanca would like another loan. On this occasion, she’ll use the loan to repair her tortilla iron on which she makes tortillas, and to buy spare parts for it. She needs her tortilla iron to be in good condition since she makes her living from cooking and selling tortillas.  
She considers that the last loan was very beneficial as she was able to maintain her family in good conditions without suffering any hardships.

loans.use: repair her tortilla iron.

loans.name: Juana Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Juana Micaela es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos, ninguno estudian,  se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y a la atención a aun molino de mixtamal, lleva 5 años de experiencia vendiendo papa y teniendo el molino, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la sastrería.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara apara la compra de papas por quintal y así mejoras sus ventas, en el futuro espera ver un negocios grande.
texts.en: Juana Micaela is married and is 51 years old.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has three children; none attends school.  She sells fried potatoes and runs a corn mill.  She has five years’ experience selling potatoes and tending to the mill.  Her husband who is a tailor helps support the family.  She’s asking for a loan to buy potatoes by the quintal to improve sales.  In the future she hopes to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes by the quintal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business

loans.name: Fortunate

texts.en: Fortunate is a 47 year old single mother to 5 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a health worker who decided to start up a small drug shop that has now grown.She hopes to grow her business to a pharmacy and educate her children. Fortunate intends use the loan facility to pay school fees

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 37 years old, she runs a grocery store to earn a living and has been in the business for 5 years. To earn extra income she runs a beauty salon. 

She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans, peas and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, peas and maize to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a 39 year old business lady from Vihiga town and is married to Absalom. They have three children. Absalom is a farmer.

Mabel operates a second hand clothes business and has been running this business for the last 5 years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000.
